desc: The course examines continuity and change in Russian political culture. The institutions and politics between the Soviet and Post-Soviet periods under the leadership of Yeltsin and Putin are explored. The course considers Russia as an energy-exporting state. The varied political developments of former Soviet republics in Europe, the Caucasus and Central Asia are compared and contrasted. Counts toward Russian area studies major and management studies concentration.
name: Russian/Eurasian Politics
notes: This course meets from September 12-November 21, 2016. Please note unique time period.

revisions.notes: This course meets from September TBA to November TBA. Team taught with a Carleton professor.

title: Russian and Eurasian Politics
